org.fluidity.foundation

Class Archives

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fluidity.foundation.Utility
      • org.fluidity.foundation.Archives

  • public final class Archives
extends Utility
    Convenience methods to work with Java archives.

    Usage Example

     Archives.read(Archives.containing(getClass()), (url, entry) -> {
     …

     return (_url, _entry, stream) -> {
         …
         return true;
     };
 });

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Archives.Cache
      Archives cache related functions.
      static interface  Archives.Entry
      Selects and reads entries in a JAR file.
      static class  Archives.Nested
      Convenience methods to handle nested Java archives.

      Name of the WEB-INF directory in WAR files.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public static int read(URL url,
                       boolean cached,
                       Archives.Entry matcher)
                throws IOException
        Reads entries from a JAR file. If the archive manifest is the first entry in the archive, its entry details will be restricted to those available in a ZipEntry.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the Java archive; this will be passed to the Archives.Entry methods.
        cached - tells whether a previously cached archive, if any, should be used (true), or a newly loaded one (false).
        matcher - the processor to send the entries to.
        Returns:
        the number of entries read.
        Throws:
        IOException - when something goes wrong reading the JAR file.

      • read

        public static int read(InputStream input,
                       URL url,
                       Archives.Entry matcher)
                throws IOException
        Reads entries from a JAR file contained in the given stream. If the archive manifest is the first entry in the archive, its entry details will be restricted to those available in a ZipEntry.
        Parameters:
        input - the archive's content; the stream will not be automatically closed.
        url - the URL archive is coming from; this will be passed to the Archives.Entry methods.
        matcher - the processor to send the entries to.
        Returns:
        the number of entries read.
        Throws:
        IOException - when something goes wrong reading the JAR file.

      • read

        public static int read(byte[] data,
                       URL url,
                       Archives.Entry matcher)
                throws IOException
        Reads entries from a JAR file contained in the given byte array. If the archive manifest is the first entry in the archive, its entry details will be restricted to those available in a ZipEntry.
        Parameters:
        data - the archive's content.
        url - the URL archive is coming from; this will be passed to the Archives.Entry.matches(URL, JarEntry) method.
        matcher - the processor to send the entries to.
        Returns:
        the number of entries read.
        Throws:
        IOException - when something goes wrong reading the JAR file.

      • open

        public static InputStream open(URL url,
                               boolean cached)
                        throws IOException
        Opens an InputStream for the contents of the given URL.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to open.
        cached - tells whether a previously cached archive, if any, should be used (true), or a newly loaded one (false).
        Returns:
        an InputStream; never null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the stream cannot be open.

      • connect

        public static URLConnection connect(URL url,
                                    boolean cached)
                             throws IOException
        Creates a connection to the given URL.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to connect to.
        cached - tells whether a previously cached archive, if any, should be used (true), or a newly loaded one (false).
        Returns:
        an URLConnection; never null.
        Throws:
        IOException - when getting the connection fails.

      • attributes

        public static String[] attributes(URL url,
                                  boolean cached,
                                  String... names)
                           throws IOException
        Returns the main attributes with the given names from manifest of the JAR file identified by the given URL.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL, pointing either to a JAR resource or an archive itself.
        cached - tells whether a previously cached archive, if any, should be used (true), or a newly loaded one (false).
        names - the list of attribute names to load.
        Returns:
        an array of strings, each being the value of the attribute name at the same index in the names parameter or null; never null.
        Throws:
        IOException - when an I/O error occurs when accessing its manifest

      • attributes

        public static String[] attributes(URL url,
                                  boolean cached,
                                  Attributes.Name... names)
                           throws IOException
        Returns the main attributes with the given names from manifest of the JAR file identified by the given URL.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL, pointing either to a JAR resource or an archive itself.
        cached - tells whether a previously cached archive, if any, should be used (true), or a newly loaded one (false).
        names - the list of attribute names to load.
        Returns:
        an array of strings, each being the value of the attribute name at the same index in the names parameter or null; never null.
        Throws:
        IOException - when an I/O error occurs when accessing its manifest

      • manifest

        public static Manifest manifest(URL url,
                                boolean cached)
                         throws IOException
        Loads the JAR manifest from the given URL. Supports URLs pointing to a Java archive, URLs pointing to any resource in a Java archive, URLs pointing to a JarFile.MANIFEST_NAME, and URLs from which JarFile.MANIFEST_NAME can be loaded.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL.
        cached - tells whether a previously cached archive, if any, should be used (true), or a newly loaded one (false).
        Returns:
        the JAR manifest; may be null if not found or has neither main nor entry attributes.
        Throws:
        IOException - when reading the URL contents fails.

      • localFile

        public static File localFile(URL url)
        Returns the local file underlying the given non-nested archive URL. This method first tries to URL-decode the path and if the file exists, returns that; otherwise it returns the file at the URL's path without URL decoding.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL.
        Returns:
        the local file underlying the URL; may be null.

      • containing

        public static URL containing(Class<?> type)
        Returns the URL for the JAR file that contains the given class. If the URL does not locate an archive, an attempt is made to find the root URL for the class.

        The caller must have the RuntimePermission "getClassLoader" permission.

        Parameters:
        type - the Java class to find.
        Returns:
        the JAR URL containing the given class.

      • containing

        public static URL containing(URL url)
        Returns the URL for the Java archive that the given URL is relative to. The returned URL, if not null, can be used with a URLClassLoader.
        Parameters:
        url - the nested URL.
        Returns:
        the URL for the Java archive that the given URL is relative to; may be null if the given URL is not relative to a Java archive.

      • parseURL

        public static URL parseURL(String specification)
                    throws MalformedURLException
        Parses the given URL specification and returns the parsed URL.
        Parameters:
        specification - the archive URL in text form.
        Returns:
        an URL with the given specification.
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - when the specification does not make for a valid URL.

      • resourcePath

        public static String[] resourcePath(URL url,
                                    URL archive)
        Returns the resource path in the given URL relative to the given archive. The path will consist of all nested archives relative to the given archive leading to a resource, the name of which will be the last element of the returned array.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL, based on the archive, that refers a resource.
        archive - the archive underlying the URL; normally returned by one or more (nested) invocations of containing(URL).
        Returns:
        a resource name relative to the given archive in the given URL; may be null.

      • root

        public static URL root()
        Returns the URL for the JAR file that loaded this class.

        The caller must have the RuntimePermission "getClassLoader" permission.

        Returns:
        the URL for the JAR file that loaded this class.

      • relativeURL

        public static URL relativeURL(URL base,
                              String resource,
                              URLStreamHandlerFactory factory)
                       throws MalformedURLException
        Creates a relative URL from the given base URL and a resource in it, using the optional factory if necessary.
        Parameters:
        base - the base URL to form the relative URL to.
        resource - the resource in the base URL.
        factory - the URL stream handler to use; may be null.
        Returns:
        a relative URL.
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - if the relative URL cannot be formed.
